G.T.5917
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 9th OCTOBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
We attacked this morning north of ST.QUENTIN to the SENSEE RIVER and have made good progress. The enemy is putting up a very slight resistance. Our troops have entered CAMBRAI and have taken RAMILLIES and the crossing of the CANAL DE L'ESCAUT in that village.
South of CAMBRAI we are reported to have taken WAMBAIX, SELVIGNY and MARETZ and are approaching BOHAIN.
Further north we have made progress towards DOUAI.
French Front.
East of ST.QUENTIN the French have taken the village of ESSIGNY-LE-PETIT; they are on the western outskirts of MESNIL ST. LAURENT and have captured ITANCOURT.
On the ARGONNE front the Americans are reported to have taken CORNAY.
2. ITALIAN, BALKAN and PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
9th October, 1918.
Issued at 1 p.m.
LATER. Uncomfirmed reports say that we are approaching BUSIGNY, are in CLARY, on the western edge of LIGNY, west of CATTENIERES and are in AWOINGT. Our troops are through ESCAUDOEUVRES and ESWARS.
North of the SCARPE we are pushing on to the DROCOURT-QUEANT line which runs through VITRY, IZEL and east of DROCOURT.
